website_summaries.verdict: A silent flying insect trap that uses a glue board instead of electricity to dispatch troublesome pests.
pros: This device is quiet and is safe for a home with children and/or pets
It is lightweight, highly portable, and easy to clean
It is effective on a wide variety of flying insects, including stinkbugs
cons: The SilenTrap functions best at night if it is the only light on in the room

customer_reviews.title: Killer!
customer_reviews.text: This trap is genius and works so well. If you live where there are irritating flies - get one of these (or several). After 3 weeks of using it I noticed a couple of flies in the room and went to check to see if it was broken. The sticky wall inside the trap looked like a fly mosaic. Every bit of the sticky surface was covered by flies. I will always keep one of these going in warmer months.
customer_reviews.author: MLW

customer_reviews.title: Works Really Well
customer_reviews.text: I work from home and I leave the back door open so the dogs can go in an out without me having to get up every 20 mins or so. During the summer we get a lot of flies. We tried using fly tape, didn't really work. It took a few days to notice an difference. We tried different locations in the kitchen and on day 3-4 or so it started to really catch the flies. The only negative is that it comes with only 2 sticky papers. Both got filled up in about 4-6 weeks. I would recommend the product as it has worked really well for us.
customer_reviews.author: G-Tagss

customer_reviews.title: Unit lights up and works fine. But
customer_reviews.text: Unit lights up and works fine. But, it does not attract flies...... After two days in the house with lots of black flies and small gnats or fruit flies, it caught some of the gnats and one fly. After that, I hung up an ugly Victor fly strip. In a few days the Victor fly strip (with no light) caught about 30 flies while the Catchmaster has not caught anymore flies. Both traps are within about 10 feet of each other. I am disappointed the light does not seem to attract the flies.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Great for gnats and flying bugs
customer_reviews.text: This is the best thing I bought and I buy an lot of stuff! The gnats were aweful like infesting our new home. Not sure where they were actually coming from but think my indoor plants. It took about three weeks to kill all of them! But the first few days I noticed big change in them. I left the light on day and night and now just night incase one wants to come back! I also didn't change the sticky thing even though it was full! They just keep filling not up!
customer_reviews.author: Priscilla Newman

customer_reviews.title: Best Decision Ever
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item because I live in a motorhome. Many small insects, moths, etc. are constantly present. What I liked most was its silence, I never knew when it would capture anything. I eventually got use to the blue light which is what attracted them and then ensnared them in the gooey board.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Jackman

customer_reviews.title: It does catch bugs
customer_reviews.text: I bought this device in late summer as I was having problems with mosquitos and flies. I didn't want to spray chemical poisons in my garage or my kitchen. This does catch bugs-and does so without poisons or frying them. The only downside is the cost of replacing the sticky pads. Can't you make a $1 sticky pad?
customer_reviews.author: Cameron

customer_reviews.title: nice trap
customer_reviews.text: Great Fly Trap Light. My Distributor stopped selling them so I am forced to pay a little more here but they are worth it for small areas. No I am looking for the 10 or 12 pack refills. Hope someone lets me know where and who has the big pack refills
customer_reviews.author: Discreet Pest Control

customer_reviews.title: Great product but needs improvement
customer_reviews.text: This item controls all flying insects ( black flies, fruit flies , gnats, moths and other flying insects but doesn’t get rid of them 100%. It’s a huge challenge to completely get rid of flying insects completely. )
customer_reviews.author: Sonia D. Lacy

customer_reviews.title: Does its job.
customer_reviews.text: Great product for the price. Does its job well, bugs find a nice comfortable place to rest.........
customer_reviews.author: Ed B.

customer_reviews.title: It does the job well.
customer_reviews.text: When I first removed this from the box I was concerned about the lack of a fan but this device is very effective. I would most certainly buy this product again.
customer_reviews.author: Wyldekard

customer_reviews.title: The cord is shorter than I would have like, as I wanted to hang it up in ...
customer_reviews.text: The cord is shorter than I would have like, as I wanted to hang it up in the corner of a ceiling, but I solved it by plugging in an extension cord, and putting a timer on the outlet, so I don't have to try and reach down and plug it in. The timer makes all the difference It comes on around 10 pm and shuts off around 5 am. We don't even notice it and it has helped keep the bugs down that the kids always let in. It has even managed to catch some medium size moths.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Casey

customer_reviews.title: Nope. Broken.
customer_reviews.text: Both lights came broken and since they were gifts I missed the return window. The blue lights are not easy to find on line or at bulb stores. Thumbs down. There's a reason they are a two fer.
customer_reviews.author: Darin A. Martin

customer_reviews.title: No on/off switch???
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't make sense to me, but this product does not have an on/off switch. You have to un-plug it to shut it off. If you don't want to shut it off, then you're good, but it is a very bright night light at that point. The box states that there are 2 traps included with this product. The first box I opened, did not have the traps included as stated. Thank goodness I bought 2 refills with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: This wonderful, we had an influx of small house flies
customer_reviews.text: This wonderful, we had an influx of small house flies. Within hours it had caught so many. I like that it is quiet also.
customer_reviews.author: Susie

customer_reviews.title: looks good .. do not know it woth or not ...
customer_reviews.text: looks like it work but not as described ... well kept it as a antique pc thanks
customer_reviews.author: cliffwood beach

customer_reviews.title: Not to good
customer_reviews.text: Does not work as advertised I see bugs landing on it not in it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Total crap
customer_reviews.text: Total crap. Flies flew all around it, even landed on the outer case, but it never caught one.
customer_reviews.author: Sparker

customer_reviews.title: This solution scales nicely as you can distribute units around the house inexpensively
customer_reviews.text: Shipping container is inadequate. Two holes punched out on front of plastic housing, though it does not affect operation. Catching stink bugs and lady bugs regularly. This solution scales nicely as you can distribute units around the house inexpensively
customer_reviews.author: Robert A. Sutherland

customer_reviews.title: No glue trap
customer_reviews.text: It was supposed to come with the sticky glue trap that goes behind the light. My box had no trap, I had to order replacements and now I wait.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well. We keep one in the bar and ...
customer_reviews.text: Works well. We keep one in the bar and one in the kitchen. Plan on adding another to the basement to combat fruit flies during the summer.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. E

customer_reviews.title: Love these things
customer_reviews.text: Love these things. I remove the front grill and throw it away. They do an especially good job on stink bugs. Haven't seen any in weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Summers

customer_reviews.title: If you have flying little bugs like we have here in Puerto Rico
customer_reviews.text: If you have flying little bugs like we have here in Puerto Rico. You must have one of these in your home. Love it!!
customer_reviews.author: KrissQue

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Apartment!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to get rid of gnats in my new apartment, and it seemed to do the trick!
customer_reviews.author: Njoynlife

customer_reviews.title: Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: I returned this item on Monday July 27th for full refund. What is the status of my refund?
customer_reviews.author: M. J. Musmeci Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great bug killer. Will rid your house of mosquito's , flys, gnats and any other flying insects.
customer_reviews.author: Carol E

customer_reviews.title: Trap trips up flies!
customer_reviews.text: The insect trap does perform as advertised,especially for exterminating small,black flies.
customer_reviews.author: Jimster

customer_reviews.title: Incomplete
customer_reviews.text: Light did not work, only one glue trap in box and directions were useless.
customer_reviews.author: EG

customer_reviews.title: Silent strap
customer_reviews.text: Great for in the house. Refills are easy to handle.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Stoneking

customer_reviews.title: I'm thinking about ordering one for my daughter.
customer_reviews.text: I've only used it indoors but I'm quite satisfied. Great keeping pesky flying insects away.
customer_reviews.author: M. Howe

customer_reviews.title: Not wonderful
customer_reviews.text: The device was much as described but couldn't really tell if it would work in my application (trapping noseeums and their ilk) but decided to try it. After ~1 month of use I'm still incurring nightly attacks by the little beasts and there are only 7 insects on the sticky card. In addition, there was a real fly on the loose in the house yesterday. It just ignored the trap but the wife whiffed it with her fly swatter.
customer_reviews.author: baconboy

customer_reviews.title: ... about 90% of the little gnats that were so annoying. We found tiny creatures we did not even ...
customer_reviews.text: This unit caught about 90% of the little gnats that were so annoying. We found tiny creatures we did not even know we had flying around.
customer_reviews.author: Henry Kiser Sr.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Off the hook, discreet and it doubles as a night light.
customer_reviews.author: John Miller

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: Did not work at all. We tried it for a couple of days continuously outside and it caught two flies and a couple of gnats. We then tried it inside for a full 24 hrs and it caught nothing, despite the fact that we were plagued by several flies in the house.
customer_reviews.author: Lee B. Little Rock, AR

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended
customer_reviews.text: The bulb started to dim after a few weeks of operation, and failed completely after one month. It didn't catch many bugs during the time it did work either.
customer_reviews.author: RAS

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works well. It rid my fruit fly problem. Catches many more flys than expected.
customer_reviews.author: Robert S.

customer_reviews.title: No attractant=no good
customer_reviews.text: Not sure how flies are expected to fly into this thing without any attractant. I thought the light would bring them in better at night, but I think it helps the flies avoid it in the dark! I actually dripped some bacon grease on the sticky pad in hopes that would help to no avail. Thus far the 2 we bought have caught about 10 combined. Our daughter found the one purpose it may have--she is using it to help her flowers grow!
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: useless lump
customer_reviews.text: This product is useless. It doesn't catch flies at all. Though left plugged in for 2 days now, it comes on only intermittently and has yet to catch a single fly, of which we are well supplied (unfortunately). Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works fantastic. We had a gnat problem and this really ...
customer_reviews.text: Works fantastic. We had a gnat problem and this really did the job and is for the most part completely silent.
customer_reviews.author: Rolland Ogle

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: Works really well! It's just a bit cheap looking, but in the end what does that matter?
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the price
customer_reviews.text: Not bad for the price. Works best at night and if you house is completely dark...no light coming in from the windows.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: but I have a good hunch it will work for other bugs in the ...
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't seem to work for 'cluster flies' in the fall, but I have a good hunch it will work for other bugs in the spring and summer.
customer_reviews.author: Vol

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and effective, particularly for gnats.
customer_reviews.text: Set it up for a week. Moving it from room to room at night while sleeping. Caught about 70----mostly gnats, then no see ups, some fruit flies, a couple mosquitos, and one fly. In that I also placed some vinegar saturated pads in the bottom tray some of the days, I really don't yet know whether it works as well without vinegar. Will try without vinegar this week. Definitely works, and is very cost effective. Probably will buy another one or two soon.
customer_reviews.author: J. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Works great on gnats
customer_reviews.text: We live in upstate SC and had a problem with gnats inside our home. This device works great. It terminated 8 gnats in the first couple hours and continued to capture many more. A note to folks trying to catch fruit flies. Put vinegar and fruit - or wine - in the bottom of a jar or glass and make a paper cone to place in the mouth of the glass. The flies are attracted to the contents, fly down the cone and get stuck in the glass. [...]
customer_reviews.author: Redzinger

customer_reviews.title: couldn't be better
customer_reviews.text: Its unbelievable u can put anywhere no noise no bugs zapping in the food its everything it says on the box
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: OK if modified
customer_reviews.text: Like most devices I have tried that require flies to crawl through holes, it doesnt work well. Catches most other flying insects well. I leave the front cover off so it will catch flies also.
customer_reviews.author: JQ

customer_reviews.title: Catchmaster 906 Silent Trap Review
customer_reviews.text: This product did not catch any bugs for me. They do get attracted to the light but they do not go inside the grill to get caught on the sticky pad especially if it's a big mosquito. The big mosquito can't fit through the grill. Also, there is no on and off switch. You have to unplug this unit every time to turn it off. I would suggest getting something that has a suction fan that draws the bug in or just use the good old reliable electric zappers. This product did not work for me at all.
customer_reviews.author: Michael V. Gamba

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: Not really effective. It's attracted a few flies, but not many.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Hasn't caught any flying insects yet and I've had it for a few weeks
customer_reviews.author: Raymond Yanagita

customer_reviews.title: It is certainly easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping this would catch fruit flies. It did not. It does, however, catch house flies well. It is certainly easy to use: take it out of the box, pop the bulb in and plug it in. I have left it on day and night for a few weeks and caught less than 10 fruit flies (we have lots of them in our kitchen right now). With house flies it is a different story. Any house fly that gets in during the day is always caught by morning.
customer_reviews.author: Peter S. Gorga

customer_reviews.title: I HATE IT BECAUSE I WAS STUPID AND DIDN'T CHECK OUT ...
customer_reviews.text: I HATE IT BECAUSE I WAS STUPID AND DIDN'T CHECK OUT HOW EXPENSIVE THE GLUE BOARDS ARE I WILL BE USING OTHERS
customer_reviews.author: bev

customer_reviews.title: Waste
customer_reviews.text: i ordered 2. one came broken and did not work. i ended up using $2 fly paper and have no problems now. stick with simple. this was not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Brian D Villano

customer_reviews.title: WORKS PRETTY WELL. PLEASANTLY SURPRISED
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised. Catches loads of those really annoying little bugs that like to fly into your nose and ears. I love in Florida so anything that works for that is great. Hundreds of the little bastards are attracted to this thing and get stuck on it. Good deal.
customer_reviews.author: Dark Avenger

customer_reviews.title: A waste
customer_reviews.text: I have a massive amount of flies in my house. This stupid thing caught 1. 1 fly. Waste of money
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Elliott

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this ever.
customer_reviews.text: This device did not help to catch the fruit flies in my kitchen. It was a waste of money. Simply didn't work.
customer_reviews.author: John Nevada

product_meta.title: Catchmaster 906 SilenTrap Flying Insect Trap
product_meta.description: Catchmaster SilenTrap Flying Insect Trap quietly captures common flying pests on a glue board within the unit – eliminating the annoying buzz and unhygienic mess you get with typical zappers. Bulb and glue board replacements are available. KEEP OUT OF REACH OF CHILDREN, PETS, AND NON-TARGET ANIMALS. In case of contact with adhesive, use vegetable or mineral oil to remove from skin or animals.
feature_bullets: 13-watt UV bulb light attracts flying insects from far distances
Insects are trapped by the glue board behind the light
Discreet cover keeps trapped flies out of site

specifications.Manufacturer: Atlantic Paste and Glue Co. Inc.
specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.1 out of 5 stars107 ratings3.1 out of 5 stars
